gurmukhi: dyiK cmUM mhKwsur kI kir cMf kuvMf pRcMf DirE hY ]
transliteration: Dekh(i) Chamoond Mahkhaasur Koo Kar(i) Channd Kuvand Prachanndd Dhario Hai||
translation: Scanning the army of Mahishasura, Chandika caught hold of her fierce bow.

gurmukhi: d`Cn bwm clwie Gny sr kop BXwnk ju`Du kirE hY ]
transliteration: Dachchanndbaam Chadhaae Ghane Sar Kop Bhayaanak Juddh(u) Kario Hai||
translation: With anger, she waged the terrible war by showering the rain of her innumerable shafts.

gurmukhi: BMjn By Air ky qn qy Cut sRaun smUh Drwn pirE hY ]
transliteration: Bhanjan Bhe Ar(i) Ke Tan Te Chhoutsraoun Samoond Dharaan Pario Hai||
translation: By chopping the forces of the enemy, such a great quantity of blood fell on the ground.

gurmukhi: AwTvo isMD pcwieE huqo mno Xw rn mY ibiD ny augirE hY ]41]
transliteration: Aathvo Sindh Pachadio Houto Mano Yaa Ran Mai Bidh(i) Ne Ougadio Hai||41||
translation: As though the Lord-God hath created the eighth ocean alongwith already created seven oceans.41.

gurmukhi: kop BeI Air dl ibKY cMfI c`kR sMBwr ]
transliteration: Kop Bhaoo Ar(i) Dal Bikhai Channdoo Chakkra Sanbhaar||
translation: Chandi in great anger, holding up her disc, within the enemy’s army;

gurmukhi: eyk mwir kY dÍY kIey dÍY qy kIny cwr ]42]
transliteration: Ek Daar(i) Kai Dvai Kooe Dvai Te Koone Chaar||42||
translation: She cut off the warriors into halves and quarters.42.

gurmukhi: ieh Bwq ko ju`Du kirE suin kY kvlws mY iDAwn CuitE hir kw ]
transliteration: Ih Bhaat Ko Juddh(u) Kario Soun(i) Kai Kavlaas Mai Dhiaan Chhoutio Har(i) Kaa||
translation: Such a terrible war was waged that the profound contemplation of Shiva was infringed.

gurmukhi: puin cMf sMBwr auBwr gdw puin sMK bjwie kirE Krkw ]
transliteration: Poun(i) Channd Sanbhaar Oubhaar Gadaa Dhoun(i) Sankh Bajaae Kario Kharkaa||
translation: Chandi then held up her mace and raised a violent sound by blowing her onch.

gurmukhi: isr sqRuin ky pr ckR pirE Cut AYso bihE kir ky br kw ]
transliteration: Sir Satroun(i) Ke Par Charka Pario Chhout Aiso Bahio Kar(i) Ke Bar Kaa||
translation: The disc fell on the heads of the enemies; that disc went in such a way with the might of her hand;

gurmukhi: jnu Kyln ko srqw qt jwie clwvq hY iCClI lrkw ]43]
transliteration: Jan(u) Khelan Ko Sartaa Tat Jaae Chadaavat Hai Chhichhloo Larkaa||43||
translation: That it seemed that the children were throwing the potsherd so as swim on the surface of the water.43.
